formatted_items.content:
Here’s a ready-to-send draft. Feel free to tweak wording or add/remove items before you email the committee.

---

To: Oakwood Alumni Reunion Committee  
Subject: Latest Class of 2005 Updates for the Upcoming Reunion

Dear Reunion Committee,

I hope you’re all doing well. I’ve reviewed our Alumni Tracker and wanted to provide a concise roundup of the most recent Class of 2005 news:

• John Smith was recently promoted to Director of Marketing at Innotech Solutions.  
• Emily Johnson’s second novel has been shortlisted for a national literary award.  
• Michael Brown is leading several sustainable design projects in his role as Senior Architect at BuildTech Enterprises.  
• Jennifer Walters continues to excel in her legal career with Goodman, Lieber, Kurtzberg & Holliway.

Looking ahead, several classmates will be recognized for their philanthropic contributions at the Oakwood Charity Gala in mid-June—an excellent opportunity to spotlight alumni accomplishments and continue building excitement for the reunion.

Our contact list is now up-to-date for the majority of the class, so we’re well positioned for the next round of invitations and event reminders.

Please let me know if you’d like any further details or have other items you’d like me to include.

Warm regards,

[Your Name]  
Class of 2005 Liaison

Here’s a ready-to-send draft. Feel free to tweak wording or add/remove items before you email the committee.

To: Oakwood Alumni Reunion Committee  
Subject: Latest Class of 2005 Updates for the Upcoming Reunion

Dear Reunion Committee,

I hope you’re all doing well. I’ve reviewed our Alumni Tracker and wanted to provide a concise roundup of the most recent Class of 2005 news:

• John Smith was recently promoted to Director of Marketing at Innotech Solutions.  
• Emily Johnson’s second novel has been shortlisted for a national literary award.  
• Michael Brown is leading several sustainable design projects in his role as Senior Architect at BuildTech Enterprises.  
• Jennifer Walters continues to excel in her legal career with Goodman, Lieber, Kurtzberg & Holliway.

Looking ahead, several classmates will be recognized for their philanthropic contributions at the Oakwood Charity Gala in mid-June—an excellent opportunity to spotlight alumni accomplishments and continue building excitement for the reunion.

Our contact list is now up-to-date for the majority of the class, so we’re well positioned for the next round of invitations and event reminders.

Please let me know if you’d like any further details or have other items you’d like me to include.

Warm regards,

[Your Name]  
Class of 2005 Liaison
